unnormalised: Subject: My Journey with Yoga: From Aches to Awesome!
normalised: Subject: My Journey with Yoga: From Aches to Awesome!

unnormalised: Okay, so I'm no Baba Ramdev, but I wanted to share my experience with yoga. For years, I just dismissed it as something for "flexible people" which, let's be honest, I was definitely not. My back was constantly aching (blame those late nights finishing engineering assignments at IIT Delhi!) and I felt perpetually stiff.
normalised: Okay, so I'm no B A B A Ramdev, but I wanted to share my experience with yoga. For years, I just dismissed it as something for "flexible people" which, let's be honest, I was definitely not. My back was constantly aching (blame those late nights finishing engineering assignments at I I T Delhi!) and I felt perpetually stiff.

unnormalised: Everything changed on 26/01/2023. My doctor, after seeing my X-rays (and probably hearing me complain *again*), strongly suggested I try yoga. I reluctantly signed up for a beginners class at a nearby studio in Gurgaon.
normalised: Everything changed on twenty sixth january two thousand and twenty three. My doctor, after seeing my X-rays (and probably hearing me complain again), strongly suggested I try yoga. I reluctantly signed up for a beginners class at a nearby studio in Gurgaon.

unnormalised: The first few sessions were… challenging. I couldn't touch my toes (still can’t, completely!) and "downward dog" felt like an absolute torture device. But the instructor, Priya, was incredibly patient. She emphasized listening to my body and modifying poses as needed.
normalised: The first few sessions were… challenging. I couldn't touch my toes (still can’t, completely!) and "downward dog" felt like an absolute torture device. But the instructor, Priya, was incredibly patient. She emphasized listening to my body and modifying poses as needed.

unnormalised: Slowly, things started to shift. My back pain began to lessen. I felt more energized. I even managed to hold a plank for 30 seconds on 10/02/2023, a monumental achievement!
normalised: Slowly, things started to shift. My back pain began to lessen. I felt more energized. I even managed to hold a plank for thirty seconds on tenth february two thousand and twenty three, a monumental achievement!

unnormalised: Now, I practice yoga almost daily, usually around 06:30 hrs before my morning chai. It's become an integral part of my routine. It's not about being the most flexible person in the room; it's about connecting with my body, improving my overall well-being, and finding a little bit of calm in the chaos of daily life. Trust me, even if you're as inflexible as an old wooden door, give yoga a try. You might be surprised!
